definition: (dialect) prostitute from Guangdong (esp. one in Shanghai before the Revolution) (loanword from "handsome maid")
erhua variant of 鹹津津|咸津津[xian2 jin1 jin1]

sentences.english: Even when we reduce the salt to a fine powder , it will taste well.
sentences.chinese: 即使我們把鹽研磨成很小的粉末，他嚐起來還是鹹的。

sentences.english: It's too salty-tonight's dish, I must keep drinking more water.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的菜很鹹，害得我飯後要不停的喝水。

sentences.english: If you like the yolk of salted eggs, you can insert one in the centre.
sentences.chinese: 如果你喜歡鹹蛋黃，你可以在中間加入一個。

sentences.english: When a white mycelium develops, the cubes, are aged in salted rice wine.
sentences.chinese: 當白色菌絲形成後，豆腐塊被放在鹹的米酒中成熟。

sentences.english: Salt is good, but if it loses its saltiness, how can you make it salty again?
sentences.chinese: 鹽本是好的，若失了味，可用什麼叫它再鹹呢？

sentences.english: Features Xiantian moderate Maotai rich, unique flavor.
sentences.chinese: 特點鹹甜適中，醬香濃郁，風味獨特。

sentences.english: You are the salt of the earth, but if the salt loses its savor, with what shall it be salted?
sentences.chinese: 你們是世上的鹽。鹽若失了味，怎能叫他再鹹呢？

sentences.english: Chapter one describes the social situation in Shandong in Daoguang and Xianfeng period.
sentences.chinese: 第一章，主要講述道鹹時期山東社會狀況。

sentences.english: Musing, pondering, a breath, a briny tear, a dab of liquid or soil.
sentences.chinese: 靈犀，想仔細，一嘆，鹹苦之淚，輕拍土壤出清溪。

sentences.english: The soup is a little too salty for me.
Cajun food is often very salty and spicy.
sentences.chinese: 路易斯安那州的菜餚，通常都是即鹹又辣。

sentences.english: Salt is good: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be seasoned?
sentences.chinese: 鹽本來是好的，但如果失了味，怎能使它再鹹呢？

sentences.english: It is so salty that you can't sink when you are in the water.
sentences.chinese: 那裏的水很鹹，當你在水中時，你不會沉下去。

sentences.english: Can I have this dish changed, please? It's too salty.
sentences.chinese: 能不能請把這盤菜換一下？太鹹了。

sentences.english: The whole ocean is salty, and you are trying to be sweet.
sentences.chinese: 整個海洋是鹹的，而你卻想成爲甜的。

sentences.english: You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its saltiness，how can it be made salty again？
sentences.chinese: 你們是世上的鹽，鹽若失了味，怎能叫他再鹹呢？

definition: soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled
umami, one of the five basic tastes (cookery)
thick paste of fermented soybean/marinated in soy paste/paste/jam
grease/greasy food/oily/rich (of food)/fatty/greasy and dirty/a slippery character
to whet the appetite/appetizing/to amuse oneself at sb's expense/to tease
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
